title: Enzyme stability in polymer hydrogel–enzyme hybrid nanocarrier containing phosphorylcholine group
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,18807-18814
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02436B, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Xuejin Huang, Jincai Li, Yasuyuki Araki, Takehiko Wada, Yan Xu, Madoka Takai
Immobilization with a spacer could improve retained enzyme activity compared with direct immobilization. Zwitterionic polymer nanogels could enhance enzyme stability under various harsh conditions such as high temperature, and organic solvent.
